comments.commentBody: It is midnight, and incompetence rules supreme. No one in Congress deserves to remain in office. The people should demand their resignation, or recall them all, where it is legal. It is time the people take their country back, because our so called representatives have proven how self serving they truly are.
The appetite for debt is sort of like the love affair with the auto -- a captivity at first pleasant and entered into willingly but with all sorts of noxious side effects.

"too much risk-taking by the lords of finance, along with too big an appetite for debt among ordinary people."

While I would not let "ordinary people" off the hook entirely, the relationship between borrowers and lenders is far from equal. The lenders know the intricacies of their business and all too convince otherwise cautious people into taking on debts under terms that are (intentionally) confusing. Predatory lending is the very opposite of high risk; the lender wins both ways, either through usurious interest rates, or repossessing property in the event of a default.

Health benefits of turmeric, Basil etc have been known for centuries. It's not that traditional medicine is all bad and won't work. Just that when you have an article extolling turtle blood for common cold, it pulls down everything else with it.

The use of turtle blood is not chinese medicine!
It is chinese folk remedy not chinese medicine.
All I read are judgments without knowledge.
Read about the treatment of common cold in chinese medicine and its differential diagnosis :
You will find that nobody will prescribe for a common cold without determining if it is just a head cold, include a sore throat or coughing and without assessing if the patient has any other constitutional weaknesses.
Finally the nowhere will you find any of the formulas containing any animal
parts!!!!! The author assume it is chinese medicine but it is not!
This conversation is demented as it presents itself as a logical critic but is based on assumptions and complete absence of knowledge oft he subject in question.

I am really disheartened by many comments in this thread that seem to utterly dismiss the health benefits of acupuncture and are disrespectful, at the least, to folks who use this strategy or believe it helps them.

Due to a series of car accidents years ago I ended up with spinal fusions, and multiple disc operations. I have lived a life of much pain for decades. I will gladly
testify that while I do not really have any true conception of meridians and qi, or how they work in my body, I have experienced great relief with acupuncture. I don't care
if it is a placebo or not. For me it works. AND, with no insurance I could still afford it
at the Oregon Center for Oriental Medicine. Blessings to them! I will also say that the patient and caring students who have worked on me stand in stark contrast to the typical "doctor" appointment I have had which is rushed, cold, never mentions
nutrition or asks about me as a person and what is going on in my life that might
contribute to dis-ease or medical problems.

Double-blind studies and rigorous testing are clearly valuable but they only reveal
part of the answer. Human/humane interactions are very healing indeed and
sorely under-rated in Western medicine.
The unpredictable Barack Obama...it will be an interesting 3 more years of his presidency...with all due respect.

To what other "method of knowing" are you referring? Another method that makes use of "illogic" and "non-reasoning"? And how did you come to this conclusion? Your use of language shows that you have engaged in "logic and reasoning" after all. In the end, your statement has no discernible meaning.

I wonder how well this computer would work without all of that "Western logic"...
There is no such thing as western science, not western biology, nor western physics or chemistry. There is only science and, when it works, medicine.

Western people, with their Western cultures and sciences have certainly claimed hegemony as THE worldview for humankind. While it is not wrong to claim to importance of logic and reasoning -- the foundation of the scientific method, it has "missed out" the fact logic and reasoning is not the only method of knowing.

It is however unhelpful for the author to use live turtle blood as an example of Chinese medicine. That kind of practice is not common practice of traditional Chinese herbology, at least not outside of China. Most of Chinese herbs consist of plants, a small number are mineral and even smaller number are animal parts.
Your data?
So it's OK with you that our roads are not rebuilt after having recently been destroyed by a 1000 year flood? Think, please, think about the far-reaching consequences of what you're saying.
Good luck trying to buy or sell on the market with your local currency.
It would actually solve many problems if the Federal Government excluding the military would shut down permanently.
Do you know what an unfunded obligation is? Name one unfunded obligation of Medicaid.

Actually, the people do want Obamacare.  Wasn't that the point of the 2012 election, the 47 unsuccessful attempts to overturn it, the decision by the Supreme Court.  We do want it.  We have spoken.  Again and again and again.  You lost, accept it and move on

You could logically view the Democrats' refusal to consider the other party's amendments in 2009-10 as hostage-taking. I love the ''it's the LAW'' argument, since legal slavery was ''the law'' at one time. You should invest in some mirrors.

Yes, but I'm not sure that even with a discharge petition that a Senate measure finds its way to the House floor.

Of course, the current funding bill originated in the House, was stripped of the ACA language by the Senate, and is now back to them.

I guess we'll find out soon enough.

I do believe that if this clean funding bill were before the House, it would pass easily. All Democrats + the least insane Republicans would equal a majority.
No one in their proper mind set will support the Ruplicans position on the debt ceiling issue.

I can't tell if you think you are going to be sheared by the ACA, or are fed up with being sheared by the previous system of wolves.  I assume you are relieved to escape the corporate shearing and will vote for those that support single payer - yes?
This wonderful country spoke in the 2008 and 2012 elections. It is not the country you imagine it to be, which is why your Party hates the real America with such passion.
It is not a "bill", it is a law. Is that too hard to understand? It is the law, got it? Where is Eliot Ness when you need him? We need to send him out after these new-generation law breakers.

Hooray! I'm glad to see that politics are still alive and well! I was sincerely concerned that all of the politicians had moved into the "Good ole boy" club and left the American Citizens out to pasture for the wolves to devour....

Yes, if we're gonna have to pay for this monstrosity of a bill, than our elected leaders and their office staff should have to as well. Do they think that they're the only ones who have minimum wage workers that will be purchasing insurance on the exchanges? No, of course not! Millions of small businesses are barely getting by and can't afford to offer insurance to their employees. Many of them can't afford insurance for themselves either. I know I couldn't. Not even on the old system before the rates were so dramatically increased.

Mr. Reid is 100% correct when he says, “You know with a bully you cannot let them slap you around, because they slap you around today, they slap you five or six times tomorrow,” . We were slapped around yesterday. Then we were slapped around five or six more times. Now, this nutty group of bullies have decided that we should just sit down and accept any beating that they feel inclined to dish out. I say, "That's enough"! I'm tired of having their poor judgement shoved down my throat, and I'm ready for the government shut-down. Bring it on!

It's time to stop laying down our rights and save this wonderful country as we know it, so that our children and grandchildren can enjoy it one day as well.
We had a poll and it's called an election.

Time to shut Congress down.  Let them live the way everyone else does...furloughed, no pay, no staff, no lights.  Too long they have lived above the fray and quite frankly they ought to be ashamed of themselves and their behavior.  Republicans in general are obnoxious; but this grandstanding is injurious and unbecoming to the offices they hold.  I'd fire the lot!
A double-whammy of shutdowns today.  Very sad.  Minnesota is in the process of losing a cultural treasure of inestimable value. Vänskä and the orchestra had been making music at a sublime level.

Lowery is a brave man, and a very smart one. He is not an armchair philosopher. His crusade is founded on generosity of spirit, and righteous indignation. It's plain offensive how 'freetards' have monopolised the conversation around the sharing of cultural goods online with their idiotic onanistic rhetoric justifying demonstrably destructive and unethical practices. Keep up the good work mate, you are doing God's work.

Now that their names and smuggled letters have been published in the NYTimes for the entire world to see, are these prisoners in danger of further mistreatment and torture at the hands of their Egyptian jailers?
@Judith Bell--one person's "dronelike paraphernalia" is another's "disassembled toy size helicopter," which was mentioned in the article.
You would think. However, one only has to look at a parallel country such as China to see that a long history not a just nation makes.

"Accountability" is a word that that the Department of Education throws around all the time -- teachers must be accountable, principals must be accountable, schools must be accountable.  It turns out that  the administration does not believe the same standard of accountability should apply to themselves.  It is obvious that the DOE administration would prefer to spin the story their own way (lie) in order to avoid any accountability.  It is a shameless group of people from the top down -- and these are the folks brought in by the Mayor to change the way education is run.   I would guess that $200,000 is about what Mr. Bethiel is paid (with benefits).  Perhaps he would like to make a large donation to make things right - and perhaps the Chancellor should throw in a couple of dollars too.

From the beginning, Quinn never explained in bite-sized sound bites exactly what she was up against as City Council speaker sitting across from real estate developers who had the city's zoning laws on their side. The fact is, she had to make the hard decisions that a current & former comptroller & public advocate never had to deal with.

Nor did she ever directly address what really killed her candidacy: the widespread anger over her instrumental help in overturning term limits — to her advantage, as well as Bloomberg's.

If she had engaged her opponents in a dialogue, instead of avoiding or dismissing them, she would have had a better chance. I believe that New Yorkers are more than ready to elect a female mayor — at this point, that's a given — and, yes, a gay one. If anything, racism looms as a bigger issue than misogyny or even homophobia, and they have already elected a black mayor — and are about to elect a white man married to a black man. I believe the bigoted people in this documentary don't represent the vast majority of New Yorkers in the 21st century.

You need to re-read the column. Mr. Reeves specifically says the children from low socio-economic group do well once they are admitted into elite universities.
Social mobility is zero downward in the top 20%. And that is because children of the affluent still get into Harvard because 30% of admissions are legacies.

Replying to Nuschler below--are you sure about that statistic?  The article states that 30% of legacies are admitted, not that 30% of admissions are legacies.  These are rather different propositions.  (Though the basic point that legacies should no longer be granted an advantage still stands either way.)

Sadly, Mr. Reeves is mistaken about one fundamental fact - education matters much less for social mobility than family income. The fruits of the past 30 years of class warfare are bitter indeed for those not at the top.

Absolutely not!  The Democrats have negotiated in good faith with these anarchists for 5 years now.  They've spurned every effort by the President and the Democratic leadership to come to a fair resolution on anything whatsoever.   Moreover, the Republicans have actively sabotaged any attempt made by Mr. Obama to rescue our nation from the destruction wreaked upon it by the horrendous policies of the past Republican administration.  They've had their chance to negotiate.  Holding the American people hostage to achieve what they couldn't through our democratic process is not negotiating, it's domestic terrorism.  And we don't negotiate with terrorists.

@ R. Karch Yes, not even implying it, saying it directly. The republicans of the house shut down the government. They did this because they want to repeal Obamacare, a law that was passed by the house, upheld by the supreme court, and approved by a majority of Americans in the last presidential election.

Rather than use the legislative process they are taking hostages. The reconciliation and compromising already happened when the law was first passed.
f paine: the Dems passed a budget; the GOP refused to negotiate.  Where have you been?
Should people who are willing to shut down the government get to participate in government?  Discuss.
complete doublespeak.  But I see you're still hawking your book.

The Senate bill is available for the House to consider any time Mr. Boehner allows it to.  It's time for Mr. Boehner to put country ahead of career and have an up-or-down vote on the Senate bill.  Even if the GOP caucus boots him out as Speaker, he'll have the nation's gratitude for acting like a responsible legislator.
